name: SiebelReview: "Check No Match Property" set to TRUE for MVLs
description: This rule reports MLVs (Multi-Value Links) with "Check No Match" property set to TRUE.
output:
This rule reports Multi-Value Links with No Match property set to True.
It provides the following information:
Multi-Value Links full name
rationale:
The "Check No Match" property controls the behavior of the application when an MVL uses a primary join and the primary ID field has the value special value "No Match Row Id".

Setting the "Check No Match" property to TRUE could negatively impact performance, especially in situations where most parent records do not have child records defined in an MVG.
reference:
See the topic about how the Check No Match property impacts performance in Siebel Performance Tuning Guide:
https://docs.oracle.com/cd/E14004_01/books/PDF/PerformTun.pdf , page 188.
remediation: Set the "Check No Match" property to FALSE, if possible.
total: Number of added or modified Multi-Value Links
alternativeName: SiebelReview: "Check No Match Property" set to TRUE for MVLs

technicalCriteria.name: Efficiency - SQL and Data Handling Performance
